DOC.brief_summary: Bilateral pallidal stimulation is effective in the treatment of patients with generalised idiopathic dystonia. The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of bilateral pallidal stimulation in patients with post-anoxic generalised dystonia or non-generalised primary dystonia.
DOC.brief_title: Pallidal Stimulation in Patients With Post-anoxic and Idiopathic Dystonia
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluate the effect of bilateral pallidal stimulation on the motor disability of patients with post-anoxic generalised dystonia or primary dystonia.
DOC.criteria: Postanoxic generalised dystonia Idiopathic nongeneralised dystonia Disease duration > 1 year Contraindication to magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) Minimental status (MMS) < 24 Severe psychiatric disorder
